item.title: By: Jes Borland
item.dc:creator: Jes Borland
item.description: Nathan - thanks for reading. No, I won't be updating these posts. I haven't worked hands-on with SSRS for some time, so I wouldn't do the topics justice!
item.content:encoded: Nathan – thanks for reading. No, I won’t be updating these posts. I haven’t worked hands-on with SSRS for some time, so I wouldn’t do the topics justice!

item.title: By: nathan p
item.dc:creator: nathan p
item.description:
Have you considered updating some of these posts? There are a few alternatives to SSRS now that cam import from extra sources, edit templates in office, etc..
You can see a comparison <a href="http://www.brentozar.com/archive/2013/07/sql-server-2014-standard-edition-sucks-and-its-all-your-fault/#comment-1981111" rel="nofollow">here</a>.
item.content:encoded:
Have you considered updating some of these posts? There are a few alternatives to SSRS now that cam import from extra sources, edit templates in office, etc..

You can see a comparison here.

item.title: By: genomon
item.dc:creator: genomon
item.description: Thanks for bringing this to my attention! We have been using Access as a reporting tool since '95. This is just what I have been looking for :)
item.content:encoded: Thanks for bringing this to my attention! We have been using Access as a reporting tool since ’95. This is just what I have been looking for ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: Beat Bucher
item.dc:creator: Beat Bucher
item.content:encoded:
Hi Jess,
Thanks for this nice intro to RB 3.0… I was using RB 2.0 which IMHO sucks (when compared to years of Crystal Reports practice), and I’ve never really looked into BIDS report designer… which may be way more better then RB 2.0… Microsoft still has a lots of work to do, in order to bring up something on the table that is at least as good as CR X.
Have a great day and enjoy a cup of SB coffee ðŸ™‚
Beat
